alert.note: Alert for Ford; Iroquois (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 13 at 9:04AM CST until January 15 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST /1 PM EST/ TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT CST /1 AM EST/ TONIGHT TO NOON CST /1 PM EST/ MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow and low visibility expected. For the Wind Chill Advisory, wind chills as low as 30 below zero expected. * WHERE...In Illinois, Iroquois and Ford Counties. In Indiana, Newton, Jasper and Benton Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST /1 PM EST/ today. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight CST /1 AM EST/ tonight to noon CST /1 PM EST/ Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and low visibility due to blowing snow especially on north to south oriented roadways. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. In Illinois, the latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com. In Indiana, the latest road conditions for Indiana are available by calling 1-800-261-7623.
